title: Chicken Liver Mousse (Chris Cosentino)

ingredients.content: 54 oz Thomcord grapes, seedless, plus extra to serve
¼ tsp ground black pepper, to taste
¼ tsp Chinese five spice powder
extra virgin olive oil, to oil bread
1 tsp fresh chives, cut in pieces (1 in.)

preparations.content: Place grapes, sugar, white balsamic vinegar, pectin and citric acid into mixing bowl and blend <b>40 sec/speed 7<b>.

Place Varoma dish instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook <b>90 min/250°F/speed 1<b>. Insert measuring cup and purée <b>1 min/speed 6<b>, <b>increasing speed gradually<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside to cool.
Place a pitcher onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in canola oil and extra virgin olive oil and set aside.

Place red wine vinegar, salt, pepper and lemon juice into mixing bowl and mix <b>3 min/speed 3<b> while slowly pouring reserved oil blend onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades to create an emulsion. Adjust seasoning and acidity with additional salt, pepper and lemon juice, if needed. Return vinaigrette to pitcher and set aside.
Place 2 oz butter, shallots, garlic, jalapeño, thyme and five spice into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and cook <b>5 min/250°F/speed 2<b>.
Purée <b>20 sec/speed 6<b>, <b>increasing speed gradually<b>. Add chicken livers, salt, black pepper and pink salt and cook <b>25 min/250°F/speed 2<b>.
Add 7 oz butter and sherry vinegar, insert measuring cup and purée <b>45 sec/speed 6<b>, <b>increasing speed gradually until smooth<b>.

Spray a terrine mold with non-stick cooking spray and line mold with cling wrap. Transfer the liver purée into prepared mold. Cover with cling wrap directly touching the surface and let cool in the refrigerator overnight.
Lightly oil baguette slices with olive oil and grill until marks appear on both sides.

In a bowl place chives, tarragon, mint, mitsuba, basil, flake salt, 1 pinch black pepper and ½-1 tsp Red Wine Vinaigrette and stir to combine. Cut terrine into 1 inch thick slices, arrange on a serving plate, garnish with herbed vinaigrette mixture, Thomcord Grape Jam and fresh sage. Serve with grapes, figs, grilled baguette, mini red peppers and cornichons.
